Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.levitskii.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.levitskii.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.Impler, info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
The Implementor class implements the JarImpler interface. The Implementor can generate the implementation of interfaces (method implement(Class, Path)) and at the same time generate and package it in a jar (method implementJar(Class, Path)). Result class simple name always (after using methods this class) is interface name with suffix "Impl". Result class is not abstract and full syntax correctly. Method implementations always ignore arguments and return default values for all types. Contains main main(String[]), so may be run in cmd.

    • DELETE_VISITOR

      private static final SimpleFileVisitor<Path> DELETE_VISITOR
      Constant field only for recursively deleting temporary directory with the help Files.walkFileTree(Path, FileVisitor). Implemented inside in a reasonable way, deleting directories and files in during a visiting is equivalent to calling Files.delete(Path).

  • Method Details

    • createParentDir

      private void createParentDir(Path path) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Tries to create a full parent directory branch. This method works in exactly the manner specified by Files.createDirectories(Path p, FileAttribute[]) when p = path.getParent().
      Parameters:
      path - path to the directory to which you want to create a parent branch.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Creates an interface implementation or creates jar with interface implementations, intended for using Implementor on the command line. It should act equivalent to the following:
      • call method implement(Class clazz, Path path) when path = Path.of(".") from args = [clazzName].
      • call method implement(Class clazz, Path path) from args = [clazzName, path].
      • call method implementJar(Class, Path) from args = [-jar, clazzName, pathToJar].
      Parameters:
      args - array of arguments, which for correct working may be only in 3 forms
      • [clazzName].
      • [clazzName, path].
      • [-jar, clazzName, pathToJar].
      when clazzName - correct full name of the compiled class (only interface) visible in current classpath, path - path to the directory where you want to get the implementation, pathToJar - full name (with path) of result .jar

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> token, Path root) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Produces code implementing (only) interface specified by provided token. Generated class name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Generated source code should be placed in the correct subdirectory of the specified root directory and have correct file name. For example, the implementation of the interface List should go to $root/java/util/ListImpl.java. Result class is not abstract and full syntax correctly. Method implementations always ignore arguments and return default values for all types.
      Specified by:
      implement in interface info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.Impler
      Parameters:
      token - type token of interface to be implemented.
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If
      • the token as an interface cannot have a reasonable implementation (is null, isn't interface, is interface without the possibility of implementation, etc).
      • root is uncorrected path.
      • an I/O error occurs in the process of writing text to the required file.

    • writePackage

      private void writePackage(String classPackage, BufferedWriter outputWriter) throws IOException
      Writes package name and empty line to outputWriter. Writes according to canonical form as recommended by The Java LanguageSpecification. Writes word "package" and classPackage. Doesn't write if classPackage is empty.
      Parameters:
      classPackage - full correct name of package.
      outputWriter - A BufferedWriter.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • writeClassSignature

      private void writeClassSignature(String className, String interfaceName, BufferedWriter outputWriter) throws IOException
      Writes signature of class with name className and a parent interface with name interfaceName to outputWriter. Writes according to canonical form as recommended by The Java LanguageSpecification. Always writes modificator public.
      Parameters:
      className - name of class.
      interfaceName - full correct name of interface from which the class is inherited.
      outputWriter - A BufferedWriter.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • writeMethodSignature

      private void writeMethodSignature(Method method, BufferedWriter outputWriter) throws IOException
      Writes signature of method without arguments to outputWriter. Writes according to canonical form as recommended by The Java LanguageSpecification. Writes all method modifiers and method return type and name of method.
      Parameters:
      method - method whose signature is to be written (must be not null).
      outputWriter - A BufferedWriter.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • writeMethodReturnResult

      private void writeMethodReturnResult(Class<?> returnType, BufferedWriter outputWriter) throws IOException
      Writes primitive correct implementation of the method on the returnType to outputWriter. Should do the following:
      • if returnType is void.class, then do not write anything.
      • if returnType is boolean.class, then write something correct and equivalent "return false;".
      • if returnType is number primitive, then do write something correct and equivalent "return 0;".
      • if returnType is a reference type, the do write "return null;".
      Parameters:
      returnType - return type (must be not null).
      outputWriter - A BufferedWriter.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • writeMethod

      private void writeMethod(Method method, BufferedWriter outputWriter) throws IOException
      Write full correct method signature and primitive implementation to outputWriter. Writes according to canonical form as recommended by The Java LanguageSpecification Doesn't write if the method should not be implemented in the descendant. Write varargs method implementation only in vararg format, so in format (Object... nameArg).
      Parameters:
      method - method whose signature is to be written (must be not null).
      outputWriter - A BufferedWriter.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • getImplFileOnType

      private Path getImplFileOnType(Path root, Class<?> clazz, String type) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Creates a path to file with name root + clazzFullName + "Impl" + type, when clazzFullName is correct full name of clazz taking into account the package.
      Parameters:
      root - root directory.
      clazz - type token.
      type - file extension. Correct operation is possible with any correct file extension, but further implementation only needs .java and .class.
      Returns:
      the resulting path to new file.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - if the result is not the correct path.

      clazz - type token.
      Returns:

      Throws:

    • deleteTempDir

      private void deleteTempDir(Path root)
      Recursively deletes the entire directory. Notifies about the inability to delete (for example, when an I/O exception is caught).
      Parameters:
      root - root directory.
      See Also:
      • DELETE_VISITOR

    • compileClass

      private void compileClass(Class<?> token, Path root) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Compiles the implementation class of the passed token. Produces default compilation without special options and system messages to console about warnings and errors.
      Parameters:
      token - type token (for correct operation, it must have an implementation with a default name for the Implementor, so suffix Impl).
      root - root directory.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If
      • Could not find java compiler on the system (have not tools.jar in classpath).
      • Compilation called exit code (incorrect implementation or bad root).

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> token, Path jarFile) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Produces .jar file implementing (only) interface specified by provided token.

      Generated class name should be the same as the class name of the type token with Impl suffix added. Method implementations always ignore arguments and return default values for all types.

      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - type token of interface to be implemented.
      jarFile - output .jar file.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If
      • the token as an interface cannot have a reasonable implementation (is null, isn't interface, is interface without the possibility of implementation, etc).
      • jarFile isn't correct path.
      • has compile system problems
      • an I/O error occurs in the process of writing text to the required file.
      See Also:
      • implement(Class, Path)
